intro: Phaeocephalum brachychaetum, commonly known as the narrow-hair phaeocephalum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including regions of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less commonly studied species.
